meanings.definition: A long, pointed spear used as a weapon or in athletic events.
meanings.sent1: The warrior held his javel tightly before battle.
meanings.sent2: In the ancient Olympics, athletes would compete using a javel.
meanings.sent3: During the javelin throw competition, one athlete accidentally threw the javel backward!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a sharp javel piercing through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the javel in the sunlight was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: To throw or thrust with great force.
meanings.sent1: He tried to javel the ball across the field.
meanings.sent2: The knight javelled his sword into the enemy's shield.
meanings.sent3: She playfully javelled the pillow at her friend during the pillow fight.
meanings.sent4: The storm javelled raindrops against the window all night.
meanings.sent5: The angry chef javelled the plate into the sink, shattering it.
